alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Gordon (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 2:39AM EDT until August 29 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR EAST CENTRAL FLOYD AND WESTERN GORDON COUNTIES... At 239 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Calhoun, Resaca, Plainville, Shannon, Oostanaula, Sugar Valley and Pinson. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
